results.title: Small happiness : Life in a Chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
Despite the tremendous advances women in China have made, serious problems continue. Long Bow women talk about love, marriage, work, birth control, birth customs and the now outlawed custom of foot binding. Truly moving interviews with a Long Bow woman and her mother-in-law draw us into their lives.

results.title: All under heaven: life in a chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Dan Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow - a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. But changes have come to Long Bow, with the shift from collective to individual farming. A sense of dramatic change accompanies the simple rhythms of rural life. Part one of The Long Bow trilogy.

results.title: All under heaven: life in a chinese village
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Don Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow, a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing in Northern China. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. Documents the changes that have come to Long Bow with the shift from collective to individual farming.

group_works.title: Duke of Wellington
group_works.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions

results.title: Living with Technology
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Sound in View (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Technology”.
A visual depiction of sound waves including digital and modulated formats. The aim of this program is to teach the meanings of a number of terms used to describe the signals used in telecommunications.

group_works.title: Test pilot
group_works.creator_credit: Geoffrey Baines and BBC Film Unit

results.title: Test pilot
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Baines and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”
Appraises the qualities needed by a test pilot and shows his day to day work, not only in actual flying but also in cooperating with the back-room boys.
